what: 2.1 Basic concepts of the company alignment metric
title: Calculation of a company alignment metric
text: section, derive company alignment metric mathematically provide interpretations relevant pieces. practice, metric often calculate time \(t = 5\), can calculated point time, generalise. companies operating sectors clear technology transitions take place, certain technologies need built (\(BO\)) whilst others need phased (\(PO\)). define direction \(d\) technology \(\) sector \(b\) : \[ d_{,b} =   \begin{cases}     BO       & \quad \text{} \text{ low-carbon technology}\\     PO  & \quad \text{} \text{ high-carbon technology}   \end{cases}, \] low-carbon technology high-carbon technology mutually exclusive categories. forward-looking production plan \(p\) company \(c\) technology \(\) sector \(b\) time \(t\) : \[p_{,b,c,d,t}\] means sector level, get net production plan : \[p_{b,c,t} = \sum_{\forall \b} p_{,b,c,d,t}\] Correspondingly, scenario-based production value \(s\) company \(c\) technology \(\) sector \(b\) time \(t\) : \[s_{,b,c,d,t}\] sector level, therefore get net scenario-based production value : \[s_{b,c,t} = \sum_{\forall \b} s_{,b,c,d,t}\] define directional dummy variable \(D\) technology \(\), given direction \(d\) sector \(b\) : \[ D_{,b,d} =   \begin{cases}     1       & \quad \text{} d_{,b} = BO\\     -1  & \quad \text{} d_{,b} = PO   \end{cases} \] definitions, calculate total technology deviation (\(\Delta total\)) company \(c\) technology \(\) sector \(b\) time \(t\) : \[\Delta total_{,b,c,d,t} = (p_{,b,c,d,t} - s_{,b,c,d,t}) \times D_{,b,d}\] Note total technology deviation considered aligned >= 0 misaligned < 0. Directional dummy ensures case build phase technologies.

previous_headings: 2. The company alignment metric > 2.1 Basic concepts of the company alignment metric
title: Calculation of a company alignment metric
text: case technology trajectory transition scenario clearly classified build phase technology near medium term, treat technology bridge technology. specifically, case, production trajectory technology remains stagnant changes vary direction time frame needed carry new investments. Usually, bridge technology high-carbon technology less emissions intensive high-carbon technologies need phased first. Whether technology considered bridge technology therefore depends largely scenario assumptions sometimes differ regions even within scenario. bridge technology considered high-carbon principle, yet phased , need apply calculation incentivises production planning close scenario-based value possible. ensures overshoot undershoot lead deteriorating alignment metrics. therefore use two-sided misalignment logic, adjusts total technology deviation bridge technology \(\) time \(t\) : \[\Delta total_{,b,c,d,t}^{bridge} = -|p_{,b,c,d,t} - s_{,b,c,d,t}|\] Contrary standard formulation technology alignment deviation, technology deviation bridge technology maximum 0, basis production forecast exactly meets scenario-based value time \(t\). deviation considered misalignment. remainder calculation remains unchanged.

title: Calculation of a company alignment metric
text: Based total technology deviations calculated , can now derive net aggregate company alignment metric \(y\). derive net aggregate company alignment metric, first define calculate total deviation company \(c\) sector \(b\) time \(t\) : \[\Delta total_{b,c,t} = \sum_{\forall \b} \Delta total_{,b,c,d,t}\] note total scenario-based value company \(c\) sector \(b\) time \(t\) : \[total_{b,c,t}^{scen} = s_{b,c,t} = \sum_{\forall \b} s_{,b,c,d,t}\] definitions, derive net aggregate company alignment metric \(y\) company \(c\) sector \(b\) time \(t\) : \[y_{b,c,t} = \dfrac{\Delta total_{b,c,t}}{total_{b,c,t}^{scen}}\]

title: Calculation of a company alignment metric
text: Net Aggregate Company Alignment Metric summary alignment company sector across relevant technologies within sector. intended overall summary metric shows company aligned climate scenario aggregate. , metric meant starting point analysis. can used basis aggregate alignments individual companies loan book get high level overview alignment loan book. can also used disaggregate company alignment metric obtain granular insights underlying drivers. general, \(y_{b,c,t} >= 0\) means company - aggregate - aligned climate scenario, whereas \(y_{b,c,t} < 0\) means misaligned. technologies sector company operates , measure directional deviation corresponding scenario-based value time \(t\). positive value deviation indicates alignment negative value indicates misalignment, regardless direction technology given scenario. sum deviations across technologies divided company’s sector level scenario value time \(t\). returns percent deviation company production scenario value \(t\), \(y = 0\) means deviation, \(y = 1\) means company one hundred percent terms buildout phaseout needs \(y = -0.5\) means fifty percent less needs according scenario values. Note metric show exactly (mis)alignment comes . Hence, following analysis granular level always good idea.

what: 2.3 Build out and phase out company alignment metric
title: Calculation of a company alignment metric
text: One particular strength PACTA metrics sectors technology pathways surface misalignment technology level, matters particularly sectors include build phase technologies. Transition scenarios often assume particular technologies must phased order remain within carbon budget. Therefore, alignment metrics obscure need phase build technologies simply adding bidirectional technology deviations. account , define disaggregation net aggregate company alignment metric build phase drivers. falls short maximum granularity design, ensures opposite trends build phase obscured analysis. disaggregation net aggregate company alignment metric \(BO\) \(PO\) drivers designed resulting sum disaggregated metrics equals net metric, build phase technologies mutually exclusive sets. calculate \(BO\) \(PO\) company alignment metrics, need derive total deviation company \(c\) technology direction \(d\) sector \(b\) time \(t\) : \[\Delta total_{b,c,d,t} = \sum_{\forall \b,d} \Delta total_{,b,c,d,t}\] \(BO\)(\(PO\)) company alignment metric \(y\) company \(c\) technology direction \(d\) sector \(b\) time \(t\) defined : \[y_{b,c,d,t} = \dfrac{\Delta total_{b,c,d,t}}{total_{b,c,t}^{scen}}\] Note denominator remains net level sum disaggregated metrics net metric: \[y_{b,c,d=BO,t} + y_{b,c,d=PO,t} = \dfrac{\Delta total_{b,c,d=BO,t} + \Delta total_{b,c,d=PO,t}}{total_{b,c,t}^{scen}} = \dfrac{\Delta total_{b,c,t}}{total_{b,c,t}^{scen}} = y_{b,c,t}\] must true every technology \(\) must one one direction \(d \\left\{BO,PO\right\}\).

what: 2.4 Net aggregate company alignment metric in emissions intensity sectors
title: Calculation of a company alignment metric
text: sectors alignment calculated using emissions intensity metrics distinction build phase technologies. means net aggregate company alignment metric emissions intensity sectors \(y^*\) calculation metric much straight forward. Let emissions intensity based forward-looking production plan \(p^*\) company \(c\) sector \(b\) time \(t\): \[p_{b,c,t}^*\] also define scenario-based emissions intensity value \(s^*\) company \(c\) sector \(b\) time \(t\) : \[s_{b,c,t}^*\] derive total emissions intensity deviation (\(\Delta total^*\)) company \(c\) sector \(b\) time \(t\): \[\Delta total_{b,c,t}^* = p_{b,c,t}^* - s_{b,c,t}^*\] follows alignment measure \(y^*\) company \(c\) based emissions intensities sector \(b\) time \(t\) : \[y_{b,c,t}^* = \dfrac{\Delta total_{b,c,t}^*}{s_{b,c,t}}\]

what: 2.1 Defining exposure weights at the company/sector level
title: Calculation of exposure-weighted aggregated alignment metric
text: exposure-weighted net (buildout/phaseout) alignment given loan book calculated follows: Loan exposure \(l\) (debt outstanding) bank (loan book) \(n\) company \(c\) sector \(b\), time \(t = 0\): \[l_{n,b,c,t = 0}\]

what: 2.2 Aggregating the company/sector level metric to the loan book by sector level
title: Calculation of exposure-weighted aggregated alignment metric
text: derive exposure-weighted company net alignment metric \(Y\) sector: \[Y_{n,b,c,t} = \dfrac{l_{n,b,c,t=0}}{\sum_{b,c} l_{n,b,c,t=0}} \times y_{b,c,t}\] Finally, exposure-weighted net alignment metric \(Y\) loan book sector level follows : \[Y_{n,b,t} = \sum_{c} Y_{n,b,c,t} \] applicable, obtain exposure-weighted buildout/phaseout-alignment metric company : \[Y_{n,b,c,d,t} = \dfrac{l_{n,b,c,t=0}}{\sum_{b,c} l_{n,b,c,t=0}} \times y_{b,c,d,t}\] correspondingly, exposure-weighted buildout/phaseout-alignment metric can calculated loan book level : \[Y_{n,b,d,t} = \sum_{c} Y_{n,b,c,d,t} \]

text: data data.frame. Holds PACTA Banks TMS results. Must calculated according increasing/decreasing logic CA100+ calculation must return unweighted company level TMSR results. technology_direction data frame indicates technologies considered phase technologies versus build technologies scenario_source Character. Vector indicates scenario_source use reference calculation alignment metrics. Currently, supported value "geco_2021". scenario Character. Vector indicates scenario calculate alignment metric . Must scenario available scenario_source. bridge_tech Character. Vector indicates technology considered bridge technology. .e. scenario requires temporary build despite need long term phase . , alignment metric can treated differently technologies. Currently, allowed values ("none", "gascap"). Default "none" means special calculations applied technology. time_frame Integer length one. number forward looking years considered analysis. Standard time_frame PACTA five years.

Defines initial year analysis. company weights picked based production capacity start_year. region_isos data frame containing regional mapping scenarios country iso codes, following format r2dii.data::region_isos benchmark_region character vector length 1. Select region based benchmark loan book created. companies production within selceted region kept.
